message: put the link in the comment so ppl can click on it?
for me, it sounds like instead of 'hire slow, fire fast.' he hired fast and didn't like the result
It's like Kevin Rose had not realized he wasn't thinking that but actually had said it outloud, publicly even in a show.

IMHO, beware any company who is hiring developers at a furious pace.  Hiring a few key, and talented engineers far outweighs a group ten times its size of box coders.  Not to make the all-to-painful comparison but look at what reddit has done with a tiny fraction of the staff that digg has, even today?
I think he's correct that throwing warm bodies at problems is a bad approach. Him calling former employees B and C grade is a little awkward.
It's not like he's an expert coder who read through the code or anything, right?
He paraphrased a Jobs quote. Steve said that A people hire A people. B people hire C people.
